meanings.definition: The practice of pretending to have medical skills or knowledge without actually having them.
meanings.sent1: She fell victim to quackeries when she trusted a fake doctor.
meanings.sent2: The government cracked down on quackeries in the healthcare industry.
meanings.sent3: The quackeries of the con artist pretending to be a doctor were exposed by a real physician.
meanings.sent4: His quackeries were like a mirage in the desert, promising relief but offering only deception.
meanings.sent5: The dangers of quackeries in medicine cannot be underestimated.

meanings.definition: Deceptive or fraudulent practices or beliefs.
meanings.sent1: The company was involved in quackeries to manipulate their financial reports.
meanings.sent2: Consumers should be cautious of falling for quackeries promising unrealistic results.
meanings.sent3: The quackeries of the scam artist were finally brought to light by an investigation.
meanings.sent4: Her quackeries were like a tangled web, trapping those who believed in her deceit.
meanings.sent5: The community was outraged by the quackeries of the fraudulent scheme.
